posts.post_content: The card on it's own is very good, but combo is the reason this is banned and restricted. [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis) and [High Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=High Tide) abuses this. As said before, fastbond too. Unrestricting fastbond OR gush would lead to absolutely broken decks in vintage.

posts.post_content:
When used correctly, this card can do horrifying things. Outside of the aforementioned [Fastbond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fastbond) combos and synergies with landfall, one of the best uses for this card is in decks using [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis). Using [Gush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gush), you can return your permanently tapped Islands to your hand, draw two new cards, and then over the next two turns lay them both down again, partially counteracting the downside of [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis) shutting down your mana base ([Daze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Daze), [Thwart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thwart), and particularly [Ensnare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ensnare) also combo with Stasis like this exceptionally well).  
  
This card also works very well with [Foil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foil), allowing you to bounce two Islands to your hand, draw two cards, discard two cards (probably those Islands you bounced), and counter target spell. In brief, that's:  
  
Sacrifice two Islands: Counter target spell and draw two cards.  
  
This is banned in Legacy and restricted in... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
When used correctly, this card can do horrifying things. Outside of the aforementioned Fastbond combos and synergies with landfall, one of the best uses for this card is in decks using Stasis. Using Gush, you can return your permanently tapped Islands to your hand, draw two new cards, and then over the next two turns lay them both down again, partially counteracting the downside of Stasis shutting down your mana base (Daze, Thwart, and particularly Ensnare also combo with Stasis like this exceptionally well).

This card also works very well with Foil, allowing you to bounce two Islands to your hand, draw two cards, discard two cards (probably those Islands you bounced), and counter target spell. In brief, that's:

Sacrifice two Islands: Counter target spell and draw two cards.

This is banned in Legacy and restricted in... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Stellar card. Epic flavor text, too. *Don't trust your secrets to the sea.*  
  
They unrestricted this in Vintage, and now Gush [Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage) decks are landing Top 8 spots with regularity. (Which makes no sense at first -- Snapcaster doesn't let you pay the alternative cost of Gush. You can, however, snapcast [Mana Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Drain).)
